H0.text: We call it a ‘full stop’ what do Americans call it. Dot

H1.text: We call it a ‘full stop’ what do Americans call it. Stop Sign

H2.text: We call it a ‘full stop’ what do Americans call it. End Mark

H3.text: We call it a ‘full stop’ what do Americans call it. Peroid

A4.text: In American English, the word 'period' serves this function.

A5.text: The word period was used as a name for what printers often called the 'full point', the punctuation mark that was a dot on the baseline and used in several situations.

A6.text: The character known as the full point or full stop in British and Commonwealth English and as the period in North American English serves multiple purposes.
